content.heading: The Highest Screen Resolution? Your Eyes.
content.text:
Reconnect started in college as an award-winning campaign to encourage people to spend less time on their electronics and more time exploring the world for themselves. Between raising money for charity, documenting 6-month long adventures, and providing resources for those looking to get outside more, it has since grown to so much more.

Reconnect.life

content.heading: Experience the World On Your Feet, Not On Your Phone
content.text: The starting point for this campaign was the realization of just how much time we spend plugged in everyday. For reference, that number is 24 years, nearly a third of your life. Through this campaign I hoped to empower people to explore the world with their own senses instead of their screens. To convey this message, I designed a logo that combines a standard electronic 'power-on' symbol with a footprint to signify power to your feet, not your phone.

content.heading: Explore Beyond Your Windows
content.text: Reconnect started as a single page infographic encouraging people to get outside. It has since evolved into a full web hub for hiking and the outdoors. The goal is to provide inspiration and information to those seeking to create their own adventures.

content.heading: Walking Distance
content.text: In the summer of 2018 I hiked 2652 miles from Mexico to Canada along the Pacific Crest Trail. While living out of a backpack, I created content, managed social media and email marketing campaigns, and raised nearly $3000 for mental health research and trail conservation efforts.

content.heading: The Sky is the Limit
content.text: Reconnect.life continues to grow with new content and new features. Plans for inspiring outdoor-merchandise and apps to track your adventures are in the works.
